title: 103_s1463
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Fairness in Education for Girls and Boys Act of 1993". The Congress acknowledges the struggles of schools in providing a conducive learning environment for both girls and boys. Studies show that women are underrepresented in math and science careers due to stereotypes. Gender equity training is necessary to address disparities in achievement. A harassment-free environment is crucial for effective learning. The Federal Government plays a crucial role in eliminating sexual harassment and abuse in schools to ensure a productive learning environment for all students through education programs. The purpose of this Act is to enhance mathematics and science education by promoting gender-fair practices, eliminating sexual harassment in schools, and improving overall instruction in federally funded education programs. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include gender-equitable instruction in mathematics and science for teachers and school personnel, as well as funding for career counseling and special programs to encourage students. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include targeted intervention and follow-up programs to encourage historically underserved students to participate fully in mathematics and science programs, including informal education sponsored by community-based organizations. SEC. 102 amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act to include statistics on sex and race or ethnicity. SEC. 103 adds that data should be collected by sex, race or ethnicity, and socioeconomic status. SEC. 104 pertains to national programs. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act is amended to include gender equity teacher training models and leadership training for girls and young women. Model programs are also updated to include these provisions. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act is amended to include gender equity provisions in computer-use programs, focusing on access and teaching practices. SEC. 105 amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act to include disseminating gender equity teacher training models and providing leadership training for girls and young women. SEC. 106 focuses on programs for computer-based instruction. SEC. 106 amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act to include model programs for gender equity in computer-based instruction and evaluation of gender equity in computer education resources. TITLE II--ELIMINATION OF SEXUAL HARASSMENT AND ABUSE

SEC. 201. DEFINITIONS.

Amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act to include an environment free from sexual harassment and abuse.

SEC. 202. TARGETED USE OF FUNDS. SEC. 202 amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act to include programs targeting the elimination of sexual harassment and abuse in schools. SEC. 203 amends the Act to ensure effective schools provide an environment free from sexual harassment and abuse. SEC. 204 amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act to address sexual harassment and violence in educational institutions. It aims to ensure the safety and well-being of students and employees. SEC. 205 amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act to include comprehensive school health education programs covering sexual harassment, assault, depression, suicide, and eating disorders.
